results.title: Stand by me
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, ACT III Communications, Andrew Scheinman, Bruce A. Evans, Raynold Gideon and Rob Reiner
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1956, four youths set out on a two-day trek through the woods surrounding their home-town of Castle Rock, Oregon, to find the undiscovered body of a dead teenager reported missing for several days. Their adventure is filled with humour and suspense as they learn about friendship and growing up. Starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland, John Cusack and Richard Dreyfuss.

results.title: Stand and deliver
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Tom Musca and Ramon Menendez
results.brief_description: Edward James Olmos gives a widely-acclaimed performance as Jaime Escalante, a dedicated Maths teacher at a Los Angeles high school where most of the inner-city students are underachievers and come from poor Latin American families. Escalante refuses to see them as losers and cajoles, pushes and inspires his class to become Maths wizards and to pass a national exam which no student of the school has ever passed before. With Lou Diamond Phillips and Andy Garcia.

results.title: Stalag 17
results.brief_description: Set in a German prisoner-of-war camp, “Stalag 17” is about a group of American sergeants confined to one barrack, trying to survive wartime restrictions and spartan conditions. Amid the soldiers is one man, Sefton, a canny operator and racketeer who has amassed a case of contraband that enables him to bribe favours, providing him with more comfortable surrounds. When a meticulously planned escape is expertly foiled, the men suspect a traitor within the ranks; soon all suspicions turn to Sefton, whose compassion has been battered out of him after years as a POW, but could he be a Nazi collaborator? Effectively utilising the confines of the barrack as an incendiary setting for pent up frustrations, Wilder successfully explores the mob mentality in a compelling manner; less compelling (at least dramatically) are the humorous moments operating as light relief which stagnate the drama, diluting the well crafted tension. “Stalag 17” was one of the first films to convey war with humour - a definite precursor to “MASH”, “Catch-22” and the campy outlandishness of “Hogan’s Heroes”. William Holden won an Academy Award for his portrayal of the embittered Sefton - a role he apparently reluctantly played. Cast includes Don Taylor, Otto Preminger, Robert Strauss, Harvey Lembeck, Peter Graves, Richard Erdman, Sig Rumann and Neville Brand.

results.title: Stage Fright
results.creator_credit: Warner Brothers First National Productions and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Drama student Eve Gill (Jane Wyman) envisions the acting challenge of a lifetime in the desperate predicament of boyfriend Jonathan Cooper (Richard Todd) who is framed for murder by the flamboyant stage star Charlotte Inwood (Marlene Dietrich). To prove Jonathan’s innocence, the naive Eve impersonates a maid and works for Charlotte but discovers that where murder is involved, life does not follow a script. Representing the glamour and bitchiness of the theatre, movie legend Marlene Dietrich makes the vain, manipulative Charlotte one of her most colourful characterisations and her rendition of Cole Porter’s “The Laziest gal in town” is both sexy and provocative. Co-starring Michael Wilding, Richard Todd, Alistair Sim, Sybil Thorndike, Joyce Grenfell and Kay Walsh. Based on a novel by Selwyn Jepson.

results.title: Stage door canteen
results.creator_credit: Sol Lesser Productions, Sol Lesser and Frank Borzage
results.brief_description: At a Stage Door Canteen in Manhattan, three enlisted men on a one-day pass to New York meet and fall in love with three hostesses working there (Cheryl Walker, Marjorie Riordan, Dorothea Kent). This film is noted for its 60 plus celebrities who star as themselves, rather than the love story that provides the backdrop for their appearance. The setting allows for a cavalcade of musical and comedy numbers as well as cameo appearances. Cast also includes William Terry, Lon McCallister and Michael Harrison.

results.title: St. Elmo's fire
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Lauren Shuler and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: This 80s Brat Pack film from Joel Schmacher depicts the ups and downs of life for a group of young college graduate friends who are looking for something beyond their diplomas. Leslie and Alex live together and argue over when to get married. Meanwhile, Kevin is secretly in love with Leslie as he passes his time writing obituaries for the newspaper. Wendy works for the welfare department and is in love with Billy, though her rich parents want her married and running the family franchise. Billy keeps living life like he just graduated, and is trying to stay faithful and sober enough to get back with his wife and baby. Jules experiences crisis after crisis as she spirals into debt, taking drugs, drinking and partying. Kirby is obsessed with an old flame. Cast includes: Rob Lowe, Demi Moore, Andrew McCarthy, Judd Nelson, Ally Sheedy, Emilio Estevez and Andie MacDowell.

results.title: Squizzy Taylor
results.creator_credit: Roger Simpson, Roger Le Mesurier and Kevin Dobson
results.brief_description: Set in the 1920’s, in Melbourne, and covering the life and experiences of the enterprising and notorious criminal Squizzy Taylor. Stars Jackie Weaver, Alan Cassell and David Atkins.

results.title: Spy hard
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Rick Friedberg, Doug Draizin and Jeffrey Konvitz
results.brief_description: Special Agent Dick Steele (Leslie Nielsen) aka Agent WD-40, is brought out of retirement to save the world from destruction and annihilation by the hands of the notorious General Rancor (Andy Griffith) who has a hidden missile at a secret base. Agent WD-40 teams up with KGB Agent Veronique Ukrinsky (Nicollette Sheridan) aka Agent 3.14, to find her kidnapped scientist father who as it turns out holds the key to foiling Rancor’s evil plan in the form of a special computer chip. Cast also includes Charles Durning, Marcia Gay Harden, Barry Bostwick.

results.title: Spotswood
results.creator_credit: Meridian Films, Smiley Films, Richard Brennan, Timothy White and Mark Joffe
results.brief_description: Spotswood is an ordinary place where nobody is ordinary, and where business as usual is very unusual! Anthony Hopkins plays Wallace, a time and motion expert who has come to Spotswood to turn the workers at the local moccasin factory from a bunch of eccentric oddballs, into a well-oiled working machine. This quirky film has a great cast, including Ben Mendelshon, Russell Crowe, Bruno Lawrence and Alwyn Kurts and is an epic saga sweeping two suburbs that is refreshing and uplifting comedy at its best!

results.title: Spirits of the air, gremlins of the clouds
results.creator_credit: Meaningful Eye Contact Film, MMA Films, Pro-image, Alex Proyas and Andrew McPhail
results.brief_description: Felix Crabtree (Michael Lake) and his sister Betty (Rhys Davis) live in a dust blown shack admist a vast desert. Felix is a wheelchair bound “Dr. Strangelove” character, obsessed with flying, while Betty is paranoid, child-like, living in a world of her own, surrounded by religous relics and obsessed by the past. When a weatherbeaten fugitive named Smith (“The Norm”) staggers towards the homestead and collapses, Felix and Betty revive him. Felix learns that he and Smith share a desire to escape - Smith from his hunters and Felix from the dusty world he is forced to inhabit. They begin to build a flying machine to carry them to a new world but Felix soon realises that it is not just physical difficulties confining them to the desert.
